name: Air Fryer Vegan Burger
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: If you are looking to cut back on your red meat intake or needing a burger to serve a vegan friend, this is the recipe for you. It comes together quickly with the help of your air fryer and has a grilled burger taste without firing up a grill. Serve on a bun with desired toppings.
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) package meatless vegetarian ground beef
1 ½ teaspoons steak seasoning (such as McCormick®)
directions: Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions
Slice burger block into 3 equal pieces; form each piece into a patty
Spray the top of one patty with nonstick spray and sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon seasoning on top
Flip over, place in the air fryer basket, and spray and season the other side
Cook in the preheated air fryer for 3 minutes
Flip with a spatula and cook until done, about 3 minutes longer
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 to 165 degrees F (70 to 74 degrees C)
Repeat to season and cook remaining burgers
